headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) Completes US$3 Billion Buyback and Reports Rising Q1 Earnings
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) reported significant growth in its recent earnings report, with net income and earnings per share both showing year-over-year increases. The company also completed a share buyback program, repurchasing a substantial amount of its shares, underlining its commitment to shareholder value. Despite this solid performance, Thermo Fisher's share price was flat over the past week, aligning with broader positive market movements driven by optimism around earnings...

headline: Thermo Fisher counters tariffs with $2bn investment into US manufacturing
summary: Following in the footsteps of several pharma companies, life sciences giant Thermo Fisher is doubling down on investments at its US sites.

headline: 3 Healthcare Stocks with Mounting Challenges
summary: Personal health and wellness is one of the many secular tailwinds for healthcare companies. Despite the rosy long-term prospects, short-term headwinds such as COVID inventory destocking have harmed the industry’s returns - over the past six months, healthcare stocks have collectively shed 12.7%. This performance was worse than the S&P 500’s 7.5% fall.

headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific Invests to Enhance U.S. Innovation and Support Customers’ Manufacturing
summary: WALTHAM, Mass., April 24, 2025--Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO), the world leader in serving science, will invest an additional $2 billion in the United States over the next four years, strengthening American innovation, manufacturing and economic competitiveness across the life sciences sector.

headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific: Tariff And Policy Impacts Look Priced In
summary: Thermo Fisher's updated 2025 guidance shows a $1 EPS, or 4.2% hit from tariffs and government spending cuts. Read why I maintain my buy rating on TMO stock.
